quiz.title: Algebraic Thinking & Expressions (Quiz 5)
quiz.subtitle: Simplifying Expressions by Combining Like Terms (10 Questions)
quiz.subject: Mathematics

questions.question: Simplify: 3x + 5x
questions.explanation: 3x and 5x are like terms (same variable x). Add coefficients: 3 + 5 = 8, keep the variable: 8x.

questions.question: What is 2y - 7y?
questions.explanation: 2y and -7y are like terms. Subtract coefficients: 2 - 7 = -5, keep the variable: -5y.

questions.question: Simplify: 4a + 3b - 2a + b
questions.explanation: Combine like terms: 4a - 2a = 2a, 3b + b = 4b. Different variables (a and b) cannot be combined: 2a + 4b.

questions.question: What is 5 + 3x - 2 + x?
questions.explanation: Constants: 5 - 2 = 3. x terms: 3x + x = 4x. Combine results: 3 + 4x. Remember: x means 1x.

questions.question: Simplify: 2m² + 3m - m² + 5m
questions.explanation: m² terms: 2m² - m² = m². m terms: 3m + 5m = 8m. m² and m are NOT like terms (different exponents).

questions.question: What is -4x + 7 - 2x - 3?
questions.explanation: x terms: -4x - 2x = -6x. Constants: 7 - 3 = 4. Combine: -6x + 4. Watch the signs!

questions.question: Simplify: 3(x + 2) + 4x
questions.explanation: First distribute: 3(x + 2) = 3x + 6. Then combine like terms: 3x + 6 + 4x = 7x + 6.

questions.question: Simplify: 5a + 2b - a - 3b + 4
questions.explanation: a terms: 5a - a = 4a. b terms: 2b - 3b = -b. Constant: +4. Different letters stay separate: 4a - b + 4.

questions.question: What is the simplified form of 2x² + 3x - x² + 4 - 2x + 1?
questions.explanation: x² terms: 2x² - x² = x². x terms: 3x - 2x = x. Constants: 4 + 1 = 5. Final: x² + x + 5.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You've mastered combining like terms, including distribution and careful sign management.
scoreMessages.70: Good work! You understand the concept but review distribution and combining terms with different exponents.
scoreMessages.50: A fair attempt. Focus on: 1) Identifying like terms, 2) Managing negative signs, 3) Following step-by-step.
scoreMessages.0: Keep practicing! Remember: Only combine terms with identical variable parts. Constants combine with constants.
